definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
place of charm and beauty/scenery of exceptional charm/completely different world

sentences.english: Black Email is spacing out in the corner, contemplating an alternative life in Nara City.
sentences.chinese: 黑邮件在角落里发呆，想着奈良城的别有洞天。

sentences.english: The supernatural and wonderful Wuyi Mountains was called"the sixteenth fairyland"by Taoism.
sentences.chinese: 武夷山钟灵毓秀，被道教尊奉为“第十六小洞天”。

sentences.english: Unexpectedly, a wife, also in possession of "Space."
sentences.chinese: 没想到，一个外藏椁里还“别有洞天”。

sentences.english: A unique scenery here, hidden but beautiful spot.
sentences.chinese: 一则此处风光独特，别有洞天。

sentences.english: Visitor are always surprised to find a door with another room behind.
sentences.chinese: 来访者总是惊异地发现一扇门后别有洞天。

sentences.english: We've been to Yalong Bay, Boao, size Cave, Big East China Sea.
sentences.chinese: 我们去过亚龙湾，博鳌，大小洞天，大东海。

sentences.english: Small cave in the Red Gate Palace Shen Jian in the Northeast.
sentences.chinese: 小洞天在红门宫东北深涧内。

sentences.english: Entered the room, but it is Journey Into Amazing Caves.
sentences.chinese: 步入房中，却是别有洞天。

sentences.english: Secreted beneath the surface of a serene Naboo lake is a world entirely different than that encountered above.
sentences.chinese: 在纳布星上，一片平静的湖面下别有一番洞天。

definition: underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
Temple in Heaven (e.g. of the Jade Emperor)
great emptiness/the void/heaven/the skies/universe/cosmos/original essence of the cosmos
time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
palace of the Dragon King at the bottom of the Eastern Sea
Tianmen sub-prefecture level city in Hubei
